title: Man shot multiple times in stable condition, teen released from hospital
content:
JACKSON, MI - A Jackson man being treated for multiple gunshot wounds suffered Thursday evening is recovering and is in stable condition, police say.
The 22-year-old man was listed in critical condition at Henry Ford Allegiance Health following a shooting at about 10:18 p.m., Jan. 12, in the 100 block of Randolph Street, said Interim Director of Police and Fire Services Elmer Hitt.
The man is now listed in stable condition and is still being treated at the hospital, Hitt said.
The second victim, a 13-year-old boy, was treated for a single gunshot wound at the University of Michigan Health Center and has since been released, Hitt said.
A Jackson man shot multiple times inside a home Thursday evening is in critical condition, police say.
Police believe earlier that evening there was a physical altercation between the 22-year-old victim and the shooting suspect, a 36-year-old Jackson man, Hitt said.
After the fight, the 36-year-old man left the home, returned with a firearm and fired several shots at the two victims, Hitt said.
While investigating the shooting, police received a call at 12:11 a.m. about another report of shots fired at a home on the 100 block of W. Morrell Street.
Police found the home had been struck multiple times and located the man suspected of the Randolph shooting inside the residence. There were no injuries reported in the Morrell Street shooting, Hitt said.
The man was arrested at the scene and charged with one count of felon in possession of ammunition. He was arraigned Jan. 13 and is currently out on bond, Hitt said.
The shooting is still under investigation.
